item.title: Interest rates: Bank of England governor admits rise painful for many
item.description: "If we don't raise rates now, it could be worse later," Bank of England boss warns as it raises rates again.

item.title: Interest rates: How a rise affects you and your money
item.description: The Bank of England has raised rates to 5% from 4.5% to control price rises.

item.title: Ukraine strikes Chonhar bridge to Crimea, says Russia
item.description: The bridge linking the peninsula to Kherson in the south was hit by British missiles, say officials.

item.title: Greece boat disaster: Two families united in grief thousands of miles apart
item.description: Up to 600 people are feared dead after the migrant boat disaster off Greece - many from Egypt and Pakistan.

item.title: Train strikes: RMT union announces three days of walkouts in July
item.description: The RMT says 20,000 members will walk out on 20, 22 and 29 July as part of a long-running dispute.

item.title: Mosquito-borne diseases becoming increasing risk in Europe
item.description: Experts say the insects, which carry viruses, have moved into new parts of the continent.

item.title: Police warn Android phone users over 999 call feature
item.description: Forces say update that lets button pushes trigger calls is bombarding operators with "silent" calls.

item.title: Covid Inquiry: Abuse of experts must stop, says Whitty
item.description: Sir Chris laments treatment as he gives evidence to Covid Inquiry on pandemic preparedness.

item.title: Windrush arrivals made UK a better place - William
item.description: The Prince of Wales pays tribute to the Windrush generation on the 75th anniversary of the first crossing.

item.title: EastEnders: Michelle Collins returns as Cindy Beale after 25 years
item.description: Actress Michelle Collins will soon be followed back on the show by on screen ex-husband Ian Beale.

item.title: UK fruit picking farms like prison, migrant worker tells peers
item.description: A South African woman tells a Lords committee about "shocking" working conditions on English farms.

item.title: Molly-Mae Hague steps down from PrettyLittleThing role to focus on being a mum
item.description: The Love Islander leaves her creative director role at PrettyLittleThing to focus on her daughter.

item.title: She helped kill Roe v Wade - now she wants to end abortion in America
item.description: Kristan Hawkins has relentlessly pursued one goal - to make abortion unthinkable and unavailable.

item.title: Windrush generation recall arrival in Britain
item.description: The Windrush generation shaped modern Britain, so what does its 75th anniversary mean to them?

item.title: What can Rishi Sunak do to tackle inflation?
item.description: There are some short-term levers the government could pull but they all involve tough political choices.

item.title: 'I saved Â£50,000 living abroad but still can't afford a mortgage'
item.description: Four people explain how rising interest rates are affecting their lives.

item.title: Train strikes: When are they and why are they taking place?
item.description: Train drivers walk out on Saturday, after a week of stoppages by both Aslef and the RMT.

item.title: Ukraine's canals dry up after dam destruction
item.description: Following the destruction of the Kakhovka dam, BBC analysis reveals the changes in the surrounding area.

item.title: Could Russia really play nuclear roulette in Ukraine?
item.description: Steve Rosenberg looks at how discussion of the use of nuclear weapons has crept into Russian media.

item.title: Windrush Day: What is Windrush and who are the Windrush generation?
item.description: It is 75 years since a ship from the Caribbean to the UK became a symbol of a mass-migration movement.

item.title: Chris Mason: Rishi Sunak is in a bind over inflation
item.description: Some in government want to ease impact of inflation but others are exasperated with "knee-jerk" interventions.

item.title: At least 30 migrants feared dead in Canary Islands disaster
item.description: The Western Africa-Atlantic migration route is considered one of the world's deadliest.

item.title: Glastonbury, Leeds and Reading will have drug safety testing
item.description: The bosses of some large UK festivals say they will be checking drugs, but smaller events aren't sure.

item.title: Teenager guilty of murdering boy at Glasgow railway station
item.description: An 18-year-old is found guilty of murder after stabbing a schoolboy at a Glasgow railway station.

item.title: SNP political icon Winnie Ewing dies aged 93
item.description: One of the most iconic figures in the Scottish independence movement has died, her family confirms.

item.title: Firefighters rescue horse from Florida swimming pool
item.description: The horse fell into the pool in Paso County after being spooked by another horse.

item.title: Arthurâs Seat killer told wife to stop being like a 'British woman'
item.description: Pregnant Fawziyah Javed secretly recorded her husband's threats - but he murdered her before she could leave.

item.title: MasterChef: Caerwyn Ash jailed for child abuse images
item.description: Caerwyn Ash is found guilty of possessing indecent images and videos of the most serious category.

item.title: Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg agree to hold cage fight
item.description: Earlier this month, Meta showed staff plans for a text-based social network designed to compete with Twitter.

item.title: Potential explosives found at Leyland house, police say
item.description: The arrest of a man over "suspicious chemicals" found at a house is not terror-related, a force says.

item.title: Miss England contest: Could the swimwear parade return?
item.description: The possibility of a swimwear parade returning to the beauty pageant has generated debate.

item.title: Sarah Snook: Succession actress to star in The Picture of Dorian Gray in London
item.description: Sarah Snook will appear in an adaptation of The Picture of Dorian Gray in London's West End.

item.title: Final Fantasy 16 producers on trying to regain fans' trust
item.description: Final Fantasy 16 producer Naoki Yoshida talks to the BBC about the game's underlying messages.

item.title: 'My muscle condition won't stop me playing Glastonbury'
item.description: Teenager Eli Crossley is playing Glastonbury after a BBC video on his health condition went viral.

item.title: UK Covid deaths among worst of big European economies
item.description: Death rates since March 2020 are up by 3% in France, 5% in the UK and 17% in the US.

item.title: Most university students working paid jobs, survey shows
item.description: There has been a big increase across the UK in the number of students earning money, research reveals.

item.title: International Boxing Association stripped by International Olympic Committee of status
item.description: The International Olympic Committee votes to strip the International Boxing Association of its status as the sport's world governing body.

item.title: Women's Ashes 2023: Sophie Ecclestone gets Jess Jonassen and Alyssa Healy in the same over
item.description: Watch as England spinner Sophie Ecclestone picks up the wickets of Jess Jonassen and Australia captain Alyssa Healy in the same over on day one of the Women's Ashes Test at Trent Bridge.

item.title: Championship fixtures 2023-24: Sheffield Wednesday and Southampton open up season on Friday, 4 August
item.description: Newly promoted Sheffield Wednesday welcome relegated Southampton to Hillsborough for the EFL season opener on Friday, 4 August.

item.title: How Victor 6000 could help in search for missing Titanic sub
item.description: Maps and graphics showing how rescue teams are racing against time as they scour a huge search area.

item.title: Hamish Harding, Shahzada Dawood and son Suleman: Who is on board Titanic sub?
item.description: An adventurer and a British businessman travelling with his son are among those on the Titanic sub.

item.title: Missing Titanic sub search in critical phase amid fears over oxygen levels
item.description: If it is still functional and intact, it may only have a small amount of oxygen left on board.

item.title: Missing Titanic submersible: Why oxygen timeline on sub may not be so fixed
item.description: Conditions aboard could be experienced differently person-to-person, experts say.

item.title: Watch: Titanic sub passenger recounts losing communications
item.description: Alan Estrada was on board the Titan last year when it lost communications at a depth of 1,000m.

item.title: Missing Titanic sub search team expand search area as oxygen fears mount
item.description: More boats and underwater vehicles will join the search for five people lost inside a submersible.

item.title: What we know about the missing Titanic sub... in 77 seconds
item.description: A massive international search effort is under way for the missing vessel as time starts running out.

item.title: Titanic sub: Safety concerns raised about missing submersible
item.description: A former employee warned of potential safety problems with the OceanGate vessel in 2018.

item.title: What we know so far
item.description: The US Coast Guard says a debris field has been found in the search for the Titan sub.

item.title: Scientist's harrowing experience trapped in submersible at Titanic wreck
item.description: Michael Guillen relives his near-death experience in a submersible on a dive to the Titanic in 2000.

item.title: Narrow, dimly lit tube with curtained-off toilet
item.description: The world's only privately owned manned submersible has a unique design and some surprising features.

item.title: Search expert describes missing friends
item.description: David Mearns knows two of the five people on board the Titanic tourist sub, which went missing on Sunday.

item.title: Titanic sub: What happens next after sounds detected in search
item.description: With oxygen supplies dwindling - under 24 hours' worth remains - the next few hours are critical.

item.title: Titanic wreck dives 'frightening at the best of times'
item.description: Ex-BBC journalist Mike McKimm recalls losing power on a submersible while visiting Titanic wreck 13 years ago.

item.title: Remote area makes search 'a challenge'
item.description: A submersible that takes tourists to the Titanic shipwreck is missing off the North American coast in the Atlantic.

item.title: What it's like on board
item.description: Two people who have been on the Titan sub say it will be challenging for rescuers to find it in time.

item.title: Watch: Inside Titanic sub before it went missing
item.description: Filmed in 2022, OceanGate's boss Stockton Rush gave a glimpse into the small vessel that travels to the Titanic wreck.

item.title: Titanic tourist submersible: Rescuers scan ocean as clock ticks
item.description: The US and Canada are urgently searching for a tourist submersible not seen since Sunday.

item.title: Titanic sub: St John's hoping for safe return
item.description: The BBC's Nadine Yousif is in Newfoundland where the expedition to the Titanic began.

item.title: Canadian city ready to help in search
item.description: Coast guard vessels are being sent to the Canadian east coast city, which is 600km from the Titanic wreck.

item.title: Mortgage deal: Five ways to save money
item.description: With interest rates rapidly rising, what do experts say about coping with costs?

item.title: Cost of living: How can I save money on my food shop?
item.description: The cost-of-living crisis continues to bite. Here are some things that can reduce the impact.

item.title: Debt: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: Mortgages: What happens if I am really struggling?
item.description: Homeowners are worried about higher mortgage costs, but lenders must help those struggling.

item.title: Mortgage calculator: how much will my mortgage go up?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much mortgage payments could go up for your household.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and why is it so high?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising remains high, driven by soaring food prices.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Cost of living: What are your rights as a tenant when you're renting?
item.description: With one in five people now renting in the UK, it's important to understand your rights as a tenant.

item.title: Five reasons why mortgages are getting us down
item.description: Rising mortgage rates are causing a headache for homeowners and buyers, so what is behind the maelstrom?
